instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Arrived with no power. No liquid damage. All power rails are present including <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0_CPU_VCCPLL_R</SIGNAL> 1.8V . <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.60v

Only power rail that is low is <SIGNAL>AL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> at 0.048V

GPU gets warm and CPU even gets warm.

Any ideas what to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>AL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> at 0.048V"
Fix that problem.

First, remove <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR>.
If still low, start removing (one by one) the power goods resistors; keep in place <RESISTOR>R7967</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Removed <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> and the power good resistors leaving <RESISTOR>R7967</RESISTOR> in place but still low

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Do you have 3V at pin 1/<RESISTOR>R7967</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Yes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Then <RESISTOR>R7967</RESISTOR> is bad.
If is good and has 3V on pin 1, same voltage must appear on pin 2, if there is no other component connected.
Or you forgot some power good resistor...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Solved. Removing power good resistors lead to a bad <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
This board is still having a issue. Missing <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> 0v

<TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR> has shorted a couple times since fixing the board. Once after replacing had 0.90V on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> but <TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR> shorted again when turning board back on afterwards.

Already replaced <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> and checked the surrounding resistors. What should be checked?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Replace <CAPACITOR>C8956</CAPACITOR> and check all traces and solders.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C8956</CAPACITOR> replaced. Traces and solders are good. 4.75V on pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C8956</CAPACITOR> 0V on pin 2

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Ohm resistance to ground at L8920?
Compare with good board.
You still have the option to disable GPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
4.20 0hm resistance to ground. Similar board is 7.6 ohm

Already replaced GPU with brand new known good GPU. While GPU was removed there was 1.2V-1.3V on L8920. When New GPU was installed went back to 0v-0.13V

Anything else to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Why didn't disable GPU first, to make a better idea about the problem?
You can still do it now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Is there a way to fix without disabling GPU? Customer wants GPU to work. These are genuine original real GPU's. 1819

no issues with them on other repairs

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Don't you want to know if there is a discrete graphics problem, or other thing???
GPU can be disabled, for test, with a simple BIOS mod...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Can you provide the mod bios?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Can be done with Medusa programmer, do you have it?
If not, upload your BIOS somewhere.

BTW, search the forum; possibly we have some test dump.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Yes i have Medusa programmer

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Then read its manual!
Has a special jumper position to do that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Medusa is not working properly. Can you modify bios please?

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oUYYaXDFMq3I7vjd8lVApeocWI_wvrbw/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Medusa gives you error?
Don't forget to remove at least one of <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11, before power up the board.
Also, do NOT do PRAM reset.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Do not have cables to mod it at this time and customer needs back asap. Was hoping you could modify the file

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Cables to mod what?
Don't you have A4064 adapter board?
[URL unfurl="true"]http://www.cmizapper.com/buy/medusa-accessories.html[/URL]

I will try to modify the BIOS later...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
No do not have A46064 adapter board but just ordered it. Only have Medusa and the TL866A at the moment.

Thank you for modifying bios when you get a chance. A4064 board will take at least a few weeks to arrive here in states

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
There are more good to have things, like A4069/70.
Tiresias GPU killer is also the best solution for actual problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Can you still provide moded bios?

threads.message:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: With mod bios board boots to apple logo and loads but very slow when switching to intel graphics. Anything else we can try to fix the GPU vcore issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Discard software issue, booting USB macOS.
